pullRequest.body:
Partially written at the AIM algebraic geometry workshop

Co-authored-by: David Swinarski

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [4634ed2fb6](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18264/commits/4634ed2fb61a84b9e162d11b23d914623eea2ce2)

Import changes exceeding 2%

| %      | File |
| -      | -    |
| +3.08% | `Mathlib.Algebra.Module.Submodule.Localization` |
| +3.09% | `Mathlib.RingTheory.Localization.Module` |

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.RingTheory.Localization.Module | 972 | 1002 | +30 (+3.09%) |
| Mathlib.Algebra.Module.Submodule.Localization | 973 | 1003 | +30 (+3.08%) |
| Mathlib.Algebra.Module.FinitePresentation | 1080 | 1085 | +5 (+0.46%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.LocalRing.Module`|2|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Module.FinitePresentation` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Flat.EquationalCriterion`|5|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Module.Submodule.Localization` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Localization.Module`|30|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ LinearMap.extendScalarsOfIsLocalizationEquiv`
`+ LocalizedModule.map`
`+ LocalizedModule.map_id`
`+ LocalizedModule.map_injective`
`+ LocalizedModule.map_mk`
`+ LocalizedModule.map_surjective`
`+ Module.FinitePresentation.isLocalizedModule_mapExtendScalars`
`+ Module.free_of_isLocalizedModule`
`+ Projective.of_ringEquiv`
`+ Submodule.localized'_bot`
`+ Submodule.localized'_span`
`+ Submodule.localized'_top`
`+ mapExtendScalars`
`+ map_comp'`
`+ map_id`
`+ map_injective`
`+ map_surjective`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

**[imports (comment with "bot fix style" to have the bot commit all style suggestions)]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/212cd0904b3ba9ff3287a757400e5ea93277a47c/Mathlib.lean#L4734-L4734
**[imports (comment with "bot fix style" to have the bot commit all style suggestions)]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/212cd0904b3ba9ff3287a757400e5ea93277a47c/Mathlib.lean#L4797-L4798
**[imports (comment with "bot fix style" to have the bot commit all style suggestions)]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/212cd0904b3ba9ff3287a757400e5ea93277a47c/Mathlib.lean#L4929-L4929
**[imports (comment with "bot fix style" to have the bot commit all style suggestions)]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/212cd0904b3ba9ff3287a757400e5ea93277a47c/Mathlib.lean#L4946-L4947
Could you prove these for `IsLocalizedModule.mapExtendScalars` instead and then specialize (if even needed with the `abbrev`)?
Or even for `IsLocalizedModule.map`? Maybe you can even extract `IsLocalizedModule.map_surjective` (and `IsLocalizedModule.map_injective` from `IsLocalizedModule.map_exact`?
I proved them for `IsLocalizedModule.map`. It's easier to prove them directly than through `map_exact`.
While you are at it, could you please also add `Submodule.localized'_top`?

Should this be called `map_comp_map` as in `IsLocalization.map_comp_map`? Also `IsLocalization.map_comp_map` is stated the other way round, but your version looks like the correct order. So I guess we keep this order and remember to fix `IsLocalization.map_comp_map` one day?
I think `map_comp_map` is describing the RHS and only makes sense if the LHS and the RHS are switched.

pullRequest.title: feat(RingTheory/*): prerequisites to the locality of projectivity

source.title: feat(RingTheory/LocalProperties): being projective can be checked locally on stalks
